description: The Student visa (subclass 500) is the primary visa for international students wishing to study full-time in a registered course in Australia.  It allows you to stay in Australia for the duration of your studies and in some cases, work part-time.

eligibility.genuine_temporary_entrant: You must demonstrate that you are a Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE), meaning you have a genuine intention to stay in Australia temporarily for study purposes and will return to Nepal after completing your course.  This is assessed based on your circumstances, immigration history, and potential ties to your home country.
eligibility.financial_requirements: You must provide evidence of sufficient funds to cover your tuition fees, living expenses, and travel costs.  This can be demonstrated through bank statements, loan documents, or sponsorship letters. The amount required varies depending on your course and location but generally starts around AUD $23,000 per year. This information is accurate as of October 26, 2023, based on information from [https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500](https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500).
eligibility.english_language_proficiency: You must meet the English language requirements, usually by providing scores from tests like IELTS, TOEFL, PTE Academic, or CAE.  The required score varies depending on your chosen course.
eligibility.health_requirements: You might need to undergo a health examination depending on your country of origin and the length of your intended stay. For Nepali Students this will be required. [https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500](https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500)
eligibility.overseas_student_health_cover_(oshc): You must have Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your visa. This is a type of health insurance specifically designed for international students.
eligibility.character_requirements: You must meet character requirements and provide a police certificate if requested.

application_procedure.coe: Obtain a Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE) from your chosen Australian educational institution.
application_procedure.online_application: Complete the online visa application form through ImmiAccount.
application_procedure.supporting_documents: Gather and upload all required supporting documents, including academic transcripts, passport, evidence of financial capacity, English language test results, OSHC details, and GTE statement.
application_procedure.visa_fee: Pay the visa application fee, which is currently AUD $650 (as of October 26, 2023).
application_procedure.biometrics_appointment: You might be required to attend a biometrics appointment.
application_procedure.processing_time: Processing times vary, so apply well in advance of your intended course start date. Check the Department of Home Affairs website for current processing times.

nepali_student_specific_information.ward_verification: Ensure all your educational documents are verified through the ward office in Nepal before submitting them.
nepali_student_specific_information.financial_documents: Clearly explain the source of your funds in your application, especially if you are relying on family sponsors.  Provide evidence of relationship with sponsors and their financial capacity. An example would be a bank statement from your parents combined with birth certificates proving the relationship.
nepali_student_specific_information.gte_statement: Write a strong GTE statement emphasizing your genuine intention to study in Australia and return to Nepal.  Highlight your ties to Nepal, future career plans in Nepal, and reasons for choosing Australia and your specific course.
nepali_student_specific_information.case_study: A Nepali student, Prakriti, secured her student visa by providing detailed financial documents from her family, a clear GTE statement highlighting her plans to return to Nepal to work in the tourism industry after completing her hospitality management course, and ensuring all her documents were ward-verified.

introduction: This document focuses on current student visa processing times for Nepali applicants as of October 26, 2023.  Processing times are estimates and can vary depending on individual circumstances and application completeness. It is crucial to check the official Department of Home Affairs website for the most recent updates.

processing_times.75_of_applications_processed_within: Check the Home Affairs website for the most up-to-date processing times.
processing_times.90_of_applications_processed_within: Check the Home Affairs website for the most up-to-date processing times.

tips_for_faster_processing.complete_application: Submit a complete application with all required documents.
tips_for_faster_processing.respond_promptly: Respond promptly to any requests for additional information from the Department of Home Affairs.
tips_for_faster_processing.apply_early: Apply well in advance of your intended course start date.

nepali_student_specific_information.document_verification: Ensure all documents are properly verified and translated. This includes educational certificates which should be attested and verified.
nepali_student_specific_information.financial_documentation: Double-check all financial documents to ensure they meet the requirements and clearly demonstrate your financial capacity. This includes funds for tuition, living costs and travel.
nepali_student_specific_information.gte_statement_importance: A well-written GTE statement can significantly impact processing time. Ensure it is clear, concise, and demonstrates your genuine intentions.
nepali_student_specific_information.case_study: A student from Nepal, Bijay, experienced a delay in his visa processing due to incomplete financial documentation. After submitting the required documents, his visa was granted within the estimated processing time. This highlights the importance of accurate and complete documentation for Nepali applicants.

title: University of New South Wales (UNSW) Entry Requirements
content: UNSW, ranked #20 globally (QS World University Rankings, 2024–2026), bases admission on academic merit and accepts various international qualifications, including high school certificates. [2]

citations.quote: Ranked #20 globally in the QS World University Rankings, 2024–2026
We accept a number of international qualifications, including some international high school certificates.

title: Australia Student Visa Overview for Nepali Students
content: Australia and Nepal have strong diplomatic ties, with around 180,000 Nepalis residing in Australia. [1]

citations.quote: Around 180,000 Nepalis have made Australia their home and they are contributing to our countries’ close relations
